Key Match Events: Chris Jordan top-scored for England with 28 from 23 balls
Brandon King's unbeaten 52 from 49 deliveries broke the back of the chase
Jason Holder took four for seven
Shai Hope was beaten by some lavish turn and stumped for 20
Sheldon Cottrell took two wickets in two balls
Pre-Game Insights: Lower-order batters Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid spared England’s blushes
Sam Billings was one of only five survivors from the side that lost to New Zealand in the T20 World Cup semi-final
England’s bowlers were efficient if non-threatening
England dealt exclusively in boundaries in the first five overs, often struggling just to lay bat on ball on a pitch showing signs of variable bounce
Post-Match Reflections: England will have little time to lick their wounds, with the next match taking place on Sunday
Miscellaneous Highlights: West Indies reached a meagre target with nine wickets and 17 balls to spare
England's Ashes batting woes transferred to the Caribbean
The Windies are without the menacing presence of Chris Gayle at the top of the order
